Comment 4: 
The part of the spec on constants http://golang.org/ref/spec#Constants seems to imply
this should work: 

"A constant may be given a type explicitly by a constant declaration or conversion, or
implicitly when used in a variable declaration or an assignment or as an operand in an
expression. It is an error if the constant value cannot be represented as a value of the
respective type. For instance, 3.0 can be given any integer or any floating-point
type..."

and a variation of your example: http://play.golang.org/p/xqvECPFCl1

Since indexing is an expression, it seems that the number should be converted to an int
if possible, according to that paragraph in the spec about constants.
